holidays.name: International Day of Solidarity with the Palestinian People
holidays.description: A day to express support and solidarity with the Palestinian people and their quest for peace and justice.
holidays.origin: Established by the United Nations General Assembly in 1977 to highlight Palestinian issues.
holidays.funFact: The day coincides with the anniversary of the UN partition plan for Palestine in 1947, making it a symbolic date for reflection and activism.

holidays.name: Square Dancing Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the lively, traditional folk dance that involves four couples dancing in a square formation, often accompanied by lively music and calls.
holidays.origin: Recognized unofficially to appreciate the cultural heritage and social aspects of square dancing.
holidays.funFact: Square dancing was once so popular in the United States that officers on naval ships used it as a form of exercise!

holidays.name: Electronic Greeting Card Day
holidays.description: A day to send and create fun, quirky electronic greeting cards to friends and family, blending technology and creativity.
holidays.origin: Emerging alongside the rise of digital communication to celebrate e-cards as a modern way to share greetings.
holidays.funFact: The first known electronic greeting card was created in 1994 by the website Blue Mountain Arts, sparking a boom in online greetings.

holidays.name: Chester Greenwood Day (Maine)
holidays.description: Honors Chester Greenwood, the inventor of the earmuff, making it a quirky local holiday in his hometown of Farmington, Maine.
holidays.origin: Celebrated locally on November 29 since the early 20th century to remember Greenwood's invention in 1873.
holidays.funFact: Greenwood was only 15 when he invented the earmuff to keep his ears warm while ice skating!
